cont.entity_a: Three out of four headphones broke apart, and the covering flaked off. The headphones have a long lifespan, lasting over ten years for some users. The headphones are durable, lasting several years with daily use.
cont.entity_b: Build quality is decent but not the best.

Sound.comm: Sound quality is clear and detailed.

cont.entity_a: Sound quality faded over time, indicating a decline in product quality. The new version has sound issues. The bass is not as deep as Beats, but high and mid-range sounds are clearer. The headphones are affordable and provide good sound quality for the price. The headphones are not noise-canceling but offer good sound isolation. The headphones are not very loud and require volume adjustment. The sound clarity is notable, revealing details not heard before. The headphones have good sound quality for the price.
cont.entity_b: Excellent sound quality with proper DAC and amp. Requires a powerful amp to drive for best sound. Highs, mids, and bass are well-balanced. Sound stage is spacious with great imaging. Sound is warm and natural.

cont.entity_a: The new version has a smaller band, delicate plastic. The headphones are lightweight and comfortable for extended use. The headphones have a comfortable over-ear design. The headphones are comfortable, with a light clamping pressure.
cont.entity_b: Open-back design provides a natural sound experience. Comfortable fit after breaking in. Comfortable for extended listening sessions. Open-back design leaks sound.

cont.entity_a: The wiring at the terminal gave out, resulting in mono sound. The long cable is inconvenient for gym use. The headphones have a six-foot cable, which can be a pro or con. The headphones have a long cord.
cont.entity_b: Left side cuts out due to contact issues, unresolved by cable replacement. Long cable included.

cont.entity_a: The bass is not as deep as Beats.
The headphones are lightweight and comfortable for extended use. The headphones are comfortable, with a light clamping pressure.

cont.entity_b: Requires a powerful amp to drive for best sound. Requires proper amplification to avoid sounding dull. Requires a good amp for optimal performance.
Great for mixing and mastering due to accuracy.
Not suitable for noisy environments due to open-back design.
